attributes.action: Failing the interests of the people, allow a vote for instant general election
attributes.additional_details: Change the law granting the power of a no confidence vote and thus a general election given to the people at any point should the people feel the government has failed them.
attributes.background: The power of the government should only be granted by the consent of the governed, and thus the law should reflect that, if the interests of the people have been failed by those representing them in the democratic parliament a vote of no confidence & general election should be granted to the people.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for a vote of no confidence in the Government. This is set out in the Committee's standards: https://petition.parliament.uk/help

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that.

You might like to sign this petition:

Call a General Election
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/700143
